title: Password Complexity

profile.name: Legal Robot
profile.about: Automated legal document review using artificial intelligence

vulnerability_information:
Hi team, 
I observe this behaviour in your website and found poor password complexity forced when registering for an account. Here are the reprdouce steps below.
Reproduce steps:

1.Open app.legalrobot-uat.com 
2.Open registration form.
3.Fill all the fields but when going for a password write a password like this ''abcdefghijklmn''
4.And your account was successfully created with this simple type of password and can easily be guessed.
Fix Or Reccomendation: 
According to password policy for choosing a secure and complex password we must consider the following points in password policy: 
Passwords should use three of four of the following four types of characters:
1.Lowercase
2.Uppercase
3.Numbers
4.Special characters such as !@#$%^&*(){}[]

In reproduce steps you can see the password which is ''abcdefghijklmn''. there is no uppercase letter forced,no numbers forced and no special characters forced by your website. If you want to make your password complexity good your should consider these four points in your password field written above. 
i usually when visit other websites and go for registering an account and when writing a password in password i observe that these password complexity points are forced by the website and you cant make a password like ''abcdefghijklmn'' which can easily guessed by someone.

Hope you'll triage this. 
Thanks 
Regards: 
Husnain Iqbal

Hi team,
I observe this behaviour in your website and found poor password complexity forced when registering for an account. Here are the reprdouce steps below.
Reproduce steps:

1.Open app.legalrobot-uat.com
2.Open registration form.
3.Fill all the fields but when going for a password write a password like this ''abcdefghijklmn''
4.And your account was successfully created with this simple type of password and can easily be guessed.
Fix Or Reccomendation:
According to password policy for choosing a secure and complex password we must consider the following points in password policy:
Passwords should use three of four of the following four types of characters:
1.Lowercase
2.Uppercase
3.Numbers
4.Special characters such as !@#$%^&*(){}[]

In reproduce steps you can see the password which is ''abcdefghijklmn''. there is no uppercase letter forced,no numbers forced and no special characters forced by your website. If you want to make your password complexity good your should consider these four points in your password field written above.
i usually when visit other websites and go for registering an account and when writing a password in password i observe that these password complexity points are forced by the website and you cant make a password like ''abcdefghijklmn'' which can easily guessed by someone.

Hope you'll triage this.
Thanks
Regards:
Husnain Iqbal

activities.message: Thanks for the report; we do have a password complexity formula that depends on several of these factors.

activities.message: No, i am able to bypass your password complexity through this kind of password '' abcdefghijklmno'' Take a look at screen shot which i am sending you. in this screen shot you can see the registration form is accepting this type of password '' abcdefghijklmno'' while you are saying that you do have a password complexity formula that depends me on these factors like, Uppercase,NumbersSpecial,characters such as !@#$%^&*(){}[] . According to screenshot your website is not forcing a user to choose a complex and secure password. Your site is allowing to choose a simple password like '' abcdefghijklmno'' and also take a look at inspect section password is acceptable. Attaching screenshot please see it @danrubins . And reproduce this with the same password and you will came to know that your website is not forcing password complexity on this simple type of password ''abcdefghijklmno"

activities.markdown_message:
https://hackerone.com/reports/191643 This is the same report of your website just a bit difference in the report you accepted this report and you are closing mine as not applicable that's totally not fair @danrubins
Thanks

Report #191643 was for a complete bypass of the password complexity functionality; in that report we showed a complexity bar but did nothing with that information, like invalidate the form. Since we only did limited disclosure on that report, I'm happy to add you to the full version so you can see the difference.

This report is not a complete bypass. As I mentioned above, we use a formula and, in fact, you can try it yourself here: https://npm.runkit.com/password-complexify

const passwordComplexify = require("password-complexify")
console.log(`Complexity for password '12345678': ${passwordComplexify('12345678')}`);
console.log(`Complexity for password 'Test@1234': ${passwordComplexify('Test@1234')}`);
console.log(`Complexity for password 'kHbji76gM(': ${passwordComplexify('kHbji76gM\(')}`);
console.log(`Complexity for password 'abcdefghijklmno': ${passwordComplexify('abcdefghijklmno')}`);

You're more than welcome to look at our client-side code, which is validating with a minimum score of 42, as well as password length between 8 and 32. For reference, a score of 42 is roughly 10 chars with Upper, Lower, Number, and Punctuation, but you could get a higher complexity score on an 8 character password by using other charsets, or get a higher score with a long string of numbers or a simple alphabet sequence, as you showed above. The string abcdefghijklmno gets a complexity score of 48.9.

activities.message: Disclosing since we're now getting duplicates of this report.
